intro: Grammitis basiattenuata var. valens, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a tropical fern species characterized by its unique, velvety fronds. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is native to Southeast Asia, including regions of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant's fronds are densely covered with short, soft hairs, giving it a soft, almost fuzzy appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks. Its botanical features make it a striking and distinctive addition to botanical collections and rainforest ecosystems.
